result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Deandre McKinnie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Billy Deandre McKinnie.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a jury status hearing.  Request for prompt disposition withdrawn.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court vacated final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Zoom appearances at the next court hearing approved by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court scheduled a jury status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 8:30 AM to address rescheduling of jury trial.  Parties notified of court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Billy Deandre McKinnie.  Attorney James C Griffin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Request for Prompt Disposition filed, expires on 01/16/2023.  Court scheduled final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  State will file an Order to Produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Received and Filed: Request for Prompt Disposition 
(sent to DA on 9/12/22 and received to DA's Office on 9/20/22)

Upon request from the State, Court vacated status conference on 10-04-22 and rescheduled matter to September 26, 2022 at 8:30 AM.  Parties notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Billy Deandre McKinnie. Attorney Williams Ackell appeared in person for Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling conference.
Court waived appearances .Court advised this case was tabbed to this court in error and should be assigned to Branch 2.
Court ordered case transferred and adjourned for a Status in Branch 2
Status hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Billy Deandre McKinnie appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. State's Witness was present. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES, THIS HEARING WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Billy Deandre McKinnie in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Billy Deandre McKinnie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
